Sequence Information.Source: Litoria caerulea (Green tree frog) (also Litoria gilleni) (Centralian tree frog)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Caerin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus cereus (MIC=50 µg/ml), Leuconostoc lactis (MIC=12 µg/ml), Listeria innocua (MIC=100 µg/ml), Micrococcus luteus (MIC=0.4 µg/ml), Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=100 µg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermis (MIC=25 µg/ml), Streptococcus uberis (MIC=100 µg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli (MIC=50 µg/ml), Pasteurella multocida (MIC=25 µg/ml). (Ref.2)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial peptide, that adopts an alpha helical conformation which can disrupt bacterial membranes. Each caerin displays a different antimicrobial specificity.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin parotoid and/or rostral glands.
Sequence Information.Domain: Contains two amphipathic alpha helix regions separated by a region of less-defined helicity and greater flexibility (By similarity).

Literature.Title: Host-defence peptides of Australian anurans structure, mechanism of action and evolutionary significance.
Literature.Author: Apponyi MA, Pukala TL, Brinkworth CS, Maselli VM, Bowie JH, Tyler MJ, Booker GW, Wallace JC, Carver JA, Separovic F, Doyle J, Llewellyn LE.

Literature.Author: Stone DJM, Waugh RJ, Bowie JH, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ.

Literature.Title: Peptides from Australian frogs. The structures of the caerins and caeridins from Litoria gilleni.
